definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to put on a hat/to be first/to dub

sentences.english: My crown, my porphyry-basined waters cool.
sentences.chinese: 我的王冠，我的斑岩底盆水凉爽。

sentences.english: RHCE is called the 'crown jewel of Linux certifications'.
sentences.chinese: RHCE被称为“Linux认证中的王冠珠宝”。

sentences.english: Youth is a ring of rose, old is the crown of thorns.
sentences.chinese: 青春是玫瑰花环，老年如荆刺王冠。

sentences.english: Saint Valentine thou who art crowned aloft.
sentences.chinese: 圣瓦伦丁河啊，你戴着王冠高高在上。

sentences.english: The decurions of every town had to scrape together gold which was presented originally in the form of crowns (aurum coronarium).
sentences.chinese: 每座城市的议事会长收集原先要做成王冠形的黄金。

sentences.english: Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown.
sentences.chinese: 戴王冠的头是不能安于他的枕席的。

sentences.english: The king took off his crown and put it on the Star-Child's head.
sentences.chinese: 国王摘下他的王冠戴在星子的头上。
比拥有王冠的明星更加璀璨。

sentences.english: Even at the age of 36, Schumacher is not ready to allow his crown to slip.
sentences.chinese: 即便已年届36岁，舒马赫尚不准备让其王冠旁落。

sentences.english: Arrogance is a kingdom without a crown.
sentences.chinese: 孤高是没有王冠的王国。

sentences.english: Kings and queens wear crowns at official ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 国王和女王列席官方典礼时戴王冠。

sentences.english: So we have to pluck the medallions from the crown.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们要拿出王冠里的图章。
他们，赤着脚，保卫着这顶王冠。

sentences.english: The gold crown was encrusted with precious gems.
sentences.chinese: 金制的王冠镶有许多贵重的宝石。

definition: laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
